value.title: DAX Fridays! #24: Running/ Cumulative totals (w Pareto chart)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to calculate cumulative totals or running totals with DAX/ powerpivot. value.title: DAX Fridays! #26: Break RANKX ties with RAND()
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how DAX RAND function works and also how to use it to break ties on the RANKX calculation to be able to create TOP X lists in Power BI.  Link to pbix file: TopN file link: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/rank-dax  Link to RANKX file: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2qzJVeYhTY

value.title: DAX Fridays! #40: DATESINPERIOD (Moving x Months average)
value.excerpt: In today's video we will learn how to use DATESINPERIOD function using Moving Average calculation.  First we will explain what a Moving average 3 months is and how it is calculated. value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. We will do two examples, how to substitute one value for another and how to substitute multiple values. value.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
value.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common.
